method.name: B.L.O.O.M. Methodâ„¢
method.fullTitle: The B.L.O.O.M. Methodâ„¢ for Women's Hormone Health
method.description: A women-centered 5-step framework specifically designed for the unique hormonal landscape of the female body. From menarche to menopause, the B.L.O.O.M. Method addresses fertility, PMS, PCOS, perimenopause, and postmenopause with evidence-based, empowering strategies.

steps.title: Biotype Assessment
steps.description: Identify the client's hormonal biotype â€” estrogen-dominant, progesterone-deficient, adrenal-driven, or thyroid-influenced â€” to personalize every recommendation.

steps.title: Lifestyle Recalibration
steps.description: Optimize the lifestyle pillars that most impact women's hormones: sleep architecture, circadian rhythm, stress patterns, and toxic exposures.

steps.title: Optimize Nutrition by Phase
steps.description: Design phase-specific nutrition that supports estrogen clearance in the follicular phase and progesterone production in the luteal phase.

steps.title: Organize Movement Patterns
steps.description: Align exercise intensity with hormonal phases â€” high intensity in follicular, moderate in ovulation, gentle in luteal â€” to support rather than stress the endocrine system.

steps.title: Monitor & Mentor
steps.description: Track cycle patterns, symptoms, and biomarkers over time. Provide ongoing mentorship through hormonal seasons and life transitions.

examQuestions.question: How many distinct phases make up the typical menstrual cycle?
examQuestions.explanation: The menstrual cycle has 4 distinct phases: menstrual, follicular, ovulatory, and luteal â€” each with different hormonal profiles that affect nutrition, exercise, and energy needs.

examQuestions.question: What does 'Biotype Assessment' mean in the B.L.O.O.M. Methodâ„¢?
options: Identifying the client's specific hormonal pattern â€” estrogen-dominant, progesterone-deficient, adrenal-driven, or thyroid-influenced
examQuestions.explanation: Biotype assessment identifies the client's specific hormonal profile (estrogen-dominant, progesterone-deficient, etc.) to personalize every subsequent recommendation in the B.L.O.O.M. framework.

examQuestions.question: Why should exercise intensity be aligned with menstrual cycle phases?
options: It doesn't matter when you exercise
Because hormonal fluctuations affect energy, recovery, and injury risk â€” exercising against your cycle can worsen hormonal imbalances
Only professional athletes need to do this
examQuestions.explanation: Hormonal fluctuations throughout the cycle affect energy levels, recovery capacity, and injury risk. Aligning exercise to cycle phases supports â€” rather than stresses â€” the endocrine system.

examQuestions.question: What is the 'gender gap' in medical research?
options: Men have more hormones than women
Women have historically been underrepresented in clinical trials, leading to health guidelines that don't account for female physiology
examQuestions.explanation: Until recently, most clinical research was conducted on male subjects, meaning medical guidelines and treatments often don't account for women's unique physiology, hormonal cycles, and health needs.

examQuestions.question: In the B.L.O.O.M. Methodâ„¢, what does the 'Monitor & Mentor' step involve?
options: Tracking cycle patterns, symptoms, and biomarkers over time while providing ongoing mentorship through hormonal transitions
examQuestions.explanation: The 'Monitor & Mentor' step combines ongoing biomarker tracking with sustained mentorship â€” guiding clients through hormonal seasons and life transitions like perimenopause, postpartum, or fertility journeys.

zombie.name: Jasmine
zombie.backstory: Busy mom of 3 who thought her mood swings, bloating, and crushing fatigue were just 'normal mom life.' Her doctor offered antidepressants. She knew there had to be a better answer.
zombie.transformation: After discovering cycle syncing and hormone optimization, Jasmine eliminated her PMS symptoms in 3 cycles. She got certified and now coaches other moms through the same transformation using the B.L.O.O.M. Methodâ„¢.
zombie.incomeStory: Jasmine earns $5,600/month running group hormone coaching programs for moms. Her 'Hormone Reset for Moms' Facebook group has 3,200 members and is her main client source.
zombie.writingStyle: Mom-voice, relatable, uses humor about parenting and hormones. Very passionate about the medical system dismissing women. Loves community building.

faq.q: How is this different from general hormone health coaching?
faq.a: The B.L.O.O.M. Methodâ„¢ is specifically designed for the female hormonal landscape â€” addressing women's unique cycle patterns, life transitions, and health needs that generic hormone coaching doesn't cover.

faq.q: Do I need a medical background?
faq.a: No. Women's hormone health coaching focuses on lifestyle, nutrition, and behavioral strategies â€” not medical diagnosis or hormone replacement therapy.

faq.q: Is this just for menopausal women?
faq.a: Not at all. The B.L.O.O.M. Method covers the full female lifespan â€” from teens with PCOS to postpartum moms to women navigating menopause.

sarah.credentials: Women's Hormone Health Expert & Cycle-Based Wellness Specialist
sarah.storySnippet: I created the B.L.O.O.M. Methodâ„¢ because I was tired of hearing women's hormonal struggles dismissed as 'just stress' or 'normal aging.' Women deserve better than a prescription pad and a pat on the head.
